item.title: Ed25519 in DNSSEC
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
DNSSEC is enabled but the specifics are up to the domain registrar. However prefect or imperfect these settings might be doesn’t really matter because at time of writing, browsers do not check DNSSEC.

By looking at https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=672600 it seems browser won’t be supporting DNSSEC either.

DNS-based Authentication of Named Entities - Wikipedia also looks dim.

References:
https://www.kicksecure.com/wiki/Dev/About_Infrastructure#DANE_TLSA

(Whonix is based on Kicksecure.)

See also:

DANE TLSA (DNS-based Authentication of Named Entities) for whonix.org Website
Lots of references / notes in the wiki: DANE TLSA For now decided not to implement it due to: low adaption no support in major browsers complex, maintenance demanding setup

item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
Check the support/usage of Ed442 or Ed25519 in DNSSEC:

The latest stable versions of OpenSSL (3.0 / 1.1.1) fully support Ed448

ed448.no

Ed448 for DNSSEC

This domain is protected with DNSSEC algorithm 16 (Ed448). Ed448 has many advantages over ECDSA P-384 (algorithm 14): it offers better security with shorter DNSKEY records, it is faster, it is not dependent on a unique random number when generating...

The latest stable versions of OpenSSL (3.0 / 1.1.1) fully support Ed25519

ed25519.no

Ed25519 for DNSSEC

This domain is protected with DNSSEC algorithm 15 (Ed25519). Ed25519 has many advantages over ECDSA P-256 (algorithm 13): it offers the same level of security with shorter DNSKEY records, it is faster, it is not dependent on a unique random number...
